channel.title: Telehealth on News
channel.description: Recent content in Telehealth on News

item.title: Telehealth, Post Net Neutrality: How We're Moving Forward
item.description: In December, the FCC voted to repeal its net neutrality rules, which would essentially give service providers the green light to start charging for differentiated Internet speed access. While efforts to block this are underway in Congress, and states are taking legal actions, healthcare providers have good reason to be concerned. In defense of the move, FCC Chairman Ajit Pai said in December that by â€œreplacing an outright ban with a robust transparency requirement and FTC-led consumer protection, we will enable these services to come into being and help seniors.
